intro: Rocama digyna, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. It features slender, often branching stems and narrow, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Rocama digyna is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
